title: Flipped Learning-Based Language Proficiency Improvement Program: Pre-Learning Video Viewing Strategies and Academic Achievement Analysis

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Language Proficiency and Experience with Online Learning Tools
context.additional_context: Learners watch pre-class videos on personal devices and engage in project-based activities during class. Analysis of video-viewing data investigates correlations with academic achievement.

learning_goals: Learners acquire foundational concepts by watching pre-learning videos in a flipped learning environment at least 80% within the specified timeframe.
Learners achieve at least 70% participation in in-class project activities based on pre-learning content.
Learners score at least 15% higher than groups with lower pre-learning video viewership and class participation in final assessments.
difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
